author: William Kan
content: Stumbled upon this place one night when I was craving for Indian food, when I turned the corner I was a bit shocked that the shop is hidden in a narrow dark side alley.  Peeping in thru the window and found that it was almost full so I decided to give it a try.  Took a few moment to understand the menu on the wall, the food they offered is fixed for the day and changes daily, you just pick 2-3 dish to go with rice or naan.  They certainly don't market it as a "decent" restaurant, the food is of good value though.
